title: Are there any songs you wouldn't listen to just because of the content of the lyrics? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have never listened to any Heavy Metal or Rap songs due to the lyrics. I have ceased from swearing, especially the “F & S “ words. You can choose to listen to such music of profanity. Such is your choice that I respect. Conversely, I ask that you respect my choice to listen to music that you may not prefer. I know that Rap also contains profanity and themes of sexual violence of all kinds, also engendering hatred of the police. I do not desire nor do I have the time to scrutinize every Rap or Heavy Metal song. My criteria in listening to any type of music is whether Jehovah God and His Beloved Son Christ Jesus would want to “sit down with me" and listen to and approve of the songs I like. My closing remarks is from is from 1 Corinthian 10:31, “Therefore, whether you are eating or drinking or doing anything else (like listening to music), do all things for God's glory.” Mahalo me ke aloha pumehana.

Yep. Anything & everything rap. Some extreme metal artists too. As far as top 40 pop music I don’t pay any attention to it. Any tunes featuring gratuitous violence & profanity especially. Misogynistic lyrics also. Political messages & preaching is a big no-no too. Actually, most of the music I listen to is either instrumental or predates a lot of the really nasty stuff lyrically that’s out there today.

I don’t enjoy most rap songs musically or lyricly, so that doesn’t matter. However, I can think of a couple of excellent pop songs which have lyrics that take away some of my enjoyment. “Man on the Moon“ by REM props up that moon-landing was-faked-conspiracy theory. “Sweet Home Alabama“ defends racism and Watergate.
My humps from the black eyed peas and kiss with a fist from Florence and the machine.
